abstract: Time Warner Cable plans to test a new price plan that would limit how much customers can download. Those who go over the limits might end up paying $4 to $30 to watch a high-definition movie.
snippet: Time Warner Cable plans to test a new price plan that would limit how much customers can download. Those who go over the limits might end up paying $4 to $30 to watch a high-definition movie.
lead_paragraph: Let’s say you buy a new Apple TV because you want to rent high-definition movies. And say you are about to move to Beaumont, Tex. If so, you might wind up paying Time Warner Cable as much as $30 when you download a movie using its high-speed Internet service.

headline.main: Time Warner: Download Too Much and You Might Pay $30 a Movie
